Package fr.cnrs.iees.graph.impl

Class ALNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.cnrs.iees.graph.ElementAdapter
      • fr.cnrs.iees.graph.impl.ALNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connected<Node>, Element, Node, Specialized, Identity, fr.ens.biologie.generic.Textable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ALDataNode, ALReadOnlyDataNode, TreeGraphNode
    public class ALNode
extends ElementAdapter
implements Node

    The Node implementation to use with ALGraph. AL stands for "Adjacency List". This class of node records its links to its neighbouring nodes as a list of ALEdges. By default, the edges are directed.

    Internally, edges are stored in two Sets, so that duplicate edges are not permitted. The test for equality between edges is based on their unique identifier Identity.id(). The constructor is hidden (protected): only ALGraphFactory can instantiate ALNodes.

    Author:
    Jacques Gignoux - 10 mai 2019

        public Edge connectTo​(Direction direction,
                      Node node,
                      ReadOnlyPropertyList edgeProperties)
        Description copied from interface: Node
        Connects this node to the node argument and return the resulting edge (will instantiate an edge), according to specified direction, adding the property list to the edge (if compatible with the EdgeFactory used to instantiate the edge). The default implementation of this method ignores the edgeProperty argument.

        connectTo in interface Node
        Parameters:

        node - the node to connect to

      • toDetailedString

        public java.lang.String toDetailedString()
        Displays an ALNode as follows (on a single line): 
         node_label:node_name=[
    →out_node_label:out_node_name  // end node of outgoing edge, repeated as needed
    ←in_node_label:in_node_name    // start node of incoming edge, repeated as needed
 ]

        e.g.: Node:0=[←Node:1 ←Node:2 →Node:3 →Node:4]

        Specified by:
        toDetailedString in interface fr.ens.biologie.generic.Textable
        Overrides:
        toDetailedString in class ElementAdapter

      • rename

        public void rename​(java.lang.String oldId,
                   java.lang.String newId)
        Description copied from interface: Identity
        renames an id to another one - CAUTION: this is for very limited use cases and should be avoided as far as possible because it breaks the id immutability paradigm. The default implementation throws an Exception.
        Specified by:
        rename in interface Identity
